data.title: Mota-Engil Begins Work on $1.8 Billion Nigeria-Niger Railway
meta_keywords: Antonio Manuel Queiros Vasconcelos Da Mota
data.meta_description: Mota-Engil SGPS SA, a Portuguese construction company, started work on a $1.8 billion railway line that will connect Nigeria with neighbor Niger.
data.text:
Portuguese construction company won contract last month

Line is latest in Nigeriaâ€™s ambitious rail expansion plans

Mota-Engil SGPS SA, a Portuguese construction company, started work on a $1.8 billion railway line that will connect Nigeria with neighbor Niger.

Transport Minister Rotimi Amaechi concluded a contract with Mota-Engil last month on the 283-kilometer (176-mile) line from the northern trading hub of Kano to the town of Maradi on the other side of the Nigeria-Niger border.
